channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Large bins on pavement, 17th February
item.description:
These bins were emptied by Southwark today. Unfortunately there remains waste on the pavement and a large crate. The presence of these bins attracts fly tipping daily. Can they be put inside a building or somewhere other than the pavement of a residential street?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Oakley Place, Old Kent Road, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Very large tree branch on pavement, 17th February
item.description:
A very large tree branch has been left on the pavement. Probably fell in Clapton Square Gardens and someone played with it / moved it, then discarded it. Dangerous to footpath, and could be misused. Situation on junction of Clarence Place and Clapton Sq

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Clapton Square, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Today's second fly tip!, 17th February
item.description:
Daily fly tipping at this location. The resident of the flat could have put this in the empty recycling bin two meters away! You guys must be as sick of this as we are by now, it must be costing the tax payer a fortune.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Mackenzie Road, Penge, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Stairs inside the blocks on Penrose house have not been cleaned for weeks . You state this issue has been resolved. It has not., 17th February
item.description:
The stairs inside the blocks on Penrose council estate have not been cleaned for weeks. The issue has not been resolved.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Penrose Grove, Walworth, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Lampost doesnâ€™t come on, 17th February
item.description:
The lampost has been out for the last few nights. The road is pitch black in the evening and night making it dangerous for residents down this road especially as some of the pavement is uneven. The lampost keeps going out since the electric car charger was installed. We need a permanent fix this time please.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 15, Partridge Road, Longlands, Sidcup, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Massive pothole in Perry Rise, 17th February
item.description:
This pothole in Perry Rise is huge and very deep and would cause serious damage to any vehicle that may hit it. Cars are actually slowing down to avoid it causing congestion at this junction. I do hope that when its fixed it is repaired properly not just the usual dollop of tarmac thrown in the hole!!! Hoping this will be repaired very soon.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Perry Rise, Perry Vale, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Numerous potholes, 17th February
item.description:

item.title: Fly tipping has not been cleared, 17th February
item.description:

item.title: Leaf mulch covering road markings, 17th February
item.description:
The yellow line outside 25 Rectory Road is hidden by the amount of leaf mulch in the gutter. It needs cleaning but also the yellow lines need resetting.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Rectory Road, Beckenham, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Abandoned vehicle not removed, 17th February
item.description:
Notice affixed to windscreen dated 29.01.26 gives x 7 days to remove. The vehicle is still there and has clearly been abandoned. Vehicle is at the end of Eastcote Road at the junction with Ashmore Grove.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eastcote Road, Falconwood, Greater London
Report on FixMyStreet
